trial_identification.studytitle:
The Use of Brief Cognitive Behavioural Therapy as a
Treatment for Food Cravings
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The use of brief Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) with individuals experiencing food cravings to study whether the use of brief CBT will lower their experience of food cravings.

interventions.interventions: Brief Cognitive Behavioural Therapy will be delivered by a registered psychologist in a group format. The program will be made up of 4 sessions each two hours in length delivered once a week.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in cravings as measured by the food cravings inventory.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before treatment, after treatment, and 3 months after completion of treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in appetite for palatable foods measured by the power of food scale.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before treatment, after treatment, and 3 months after completion of treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in the tendency to be triggered by the presence of food cues to engage in overeating measured by the revised restraint scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before treatment, after treatment, and 3 months after completion of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Before treatment, after treatment, and 3 months after completion of treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Experiencing food cravings
Being overweight or obese - have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 25 or greater
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1) eating disorder 2) psychotropic medication 3) Diabetes 4) Pregnant

trial_design.concealment: Once a suitable number of subjects have been determined to be eligible for participation in the research their names will be written on separate pieces of paper. These will then be placed into a container from which they will be drawn and placed into numbered containers.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by drawing names 'out of a hat'.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study will look at whether brief cognitive therapy is effective in helping individuals deal with food cravings.
